result.execSummary:
The defendant Gary S Williams Sr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Cocaine (<=1g), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)1g.
  • Maintain Drug Trafficking Place, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.42(1).
  • Manufacture/Deliver Cocaine (<=1g), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)1g.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Gary S Williams in court with attorney George Andrew Limbeck.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 1:03 PM. Called 15CF70, 16CF29 and 16CF52. State - here for sentencing after receiving PSI. State and counsel are prepared to proceed and both have received a copy of the PSI. State - no amendments, changes or modifications needed as far as he is concerned. Limbeck - does not believe anything dramtically affects his client refers to page 14 in regards to someone being deceased, clarifies the record. Court so notes but does not think it makes any difference in regards to the PSI. No testimomy today, just argument by counsel. State makes a remark in regards to it looks like the only order for PSI was on 15CF70 and that is the only case that a PSI was done on. Limbeck notices that as well now that the State has brought it to his attention. Both parties will be referencing the minutes from the 7/25/17 in regards to sentence recommendations. After further discussion, parties remember that the PSI was only supposed to be done on 15CF70 and they had an agreement on the other two cases, 16CF29 and 16CF52. Court agrees and will proceed today. State makes final argument prior to sentencing recommendation - on 16CF29 - 180 days jail - ordered first with prison term to run consecutive to this case - State asking for consecutive time but defense is free to argue for concurrent time; 16CF52 - withhold sentence and place on probation for 2 years - consecutive to 15CF70 - with defense free to argue on concurrent or consecutive. Limbeck agrees. State - sentencing on counts #1 and #6 on 15CF70 - State recommends 7 years in the WI State Prison System consisting of 2 years of initial confinement followed by 5 years of ES; on count #3 - 3 years in the WI State Prison System consisting of 1 year of initial confinement followed by 2 years of ES; on 16CF52 - asking for the probation to run consecutive to the ES for stated reasons - continues making argument for his recommendations. Court has question on State's recommendations in regards to 15CF70, clarifies that the prison time requested on that case is concurrent or consecutive to each other. State - concurrent to each other. Limbeck makes final argument prior to his recommendations - recommends conditional jail time and time to report to allow him to serve his sentence in the Shawano County Jail. Williams makes statement, has people in Court today that would like to speak on his behalf. Recess to allow parties to decide if someone will speak on the defendant's behalf. Back on record at 1:46 PM. Court allows Judy Murphy to make statement to the Court on behalf of the defendant. Murphy makes statement. Williams makes an additonal comment. Court sentences the defendant to the following: 15CF70 - counts #1 and #6 - 7 years in WI State Prison System consisting of 2 years of initial confinement followed by 5 years of ES - concurrent to each other, count #3 - 3 years consisting of 1 year of initial confinement plus 2 years of ES - concurrent to counts #1 and #6; 16CF29 - count #1 - 180 days in FC jail - concurrent to 15CF70, 16CF52 - place on probation for 2 years - concurrent to ES on 15CF70; court costs on all counts on all cases, submit DNA sample on all counts on each case, no possession of firearms, no voting, right to appeal, not eligible CIP but is eligible for SAP, right to appeal, set aside bond forfeiture in 16CF29 and use any bonds posted to pay costs/remainder due in 60 days/CJ, credit can be determined by counsel, adjourned.

from DE attorney (new address for DE)
Sentencing hearing on November 7, 2017 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Gary S Williams in court with attorney George Andrew Limbeck.   Charles Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 9:03 AM. Called 15CF70, 16CF52 and 16CF29. State - resolved - defense counsel will be requesting a PSI and State has no objection to the PSI being requested. Limbeck agrees. Limbeck puts agreement on the record - 15CF70 - plead G to counts #1, #3 and #6 as alleged, remaining counts to be DRI; 16CF29 - plead NC to count #1 and remaining count to be DRI; 16CF52 - plead NC to counts #1 and amend count #2 to misd BJ charge and then a NC plea would be entered to the amended count and dismiss and read in remaining counts; on 15CF70 - request for a PSI with both parties free to argue, 16CF29 - joint recommendation of 180 days in FC jail - free to argue for concurrent or consecutive to sentnece ordered on 15CF70; 16CF52 - State recommends a withheld sentence and place on probation for 2 years - consecutive to sentence on 15CF70 but defense is free to argue for consecutive or concurrent. State and Williams agree. State moves to amend count #2 to misd bail jumping contrary to 946.49(1)(a). Court amends count #2 to misd bail jumping after hearing no objections to that amendment. Defendant understands what it means for a count to be DRI. Thru the plea questionnaire, defendant pleads G to counts #1, #3 and #6 as alleged; pleads NC to count #1 on 16CF29 and pleads NC to count #1 as alleged on 16CF52 and count #2 as amended on the record. Court dismisses and reads in counts #2, #4, #5, #7, #8 and #9 on 15CF70, dismisses and reads in count #2 on 16CF29 and dismisses and reads in counts #3 and #4 on 16CF52. Court goes thru plea questionnaire, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived is constitutional rights by entering his plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, continues bond on all cases and orders a PSI. Court sets all cases for sentencing hearing. Defense puts new address on the record.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 7, 2017 at 01:00 pm.

Plea/sentencing hearing on July 25, 2017 at 09:00 am.
Defendant's invocation of the right to counsel
Demand List and Items Moved for in Discovery
Status conference on June 30, 2017 at 10:30 am.

Attorney George Andrew Limbeck in court and appears telephonically with leave of the Court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 9:20 AM. Called 15CF70, 16CF29 and 16CF52. Attorney Chad Lynch is also in the courtroom as he represents the defendant in another matter and instructs the Court that the defendant is currently incarcerated in Green Lake County serving another sentence per a letter he received from the defendant. Limbeck assumes that a WRIT was not prepared today for the defendant. Court assumes the same. State wants all matters set for FPT. Limbeck wants to look at discovery and meet with his client first and suggests setting all matters for STC at this point. Court continues bond on all matters, sets all matters for STC, all parties will appear telephonically and are to call Shawano County.  Status conference scheduled for June 30, 2017 at 10:30 am.
Status conference on May 16, 2017 at 09:15 am.
Status conference on February 27, 2017 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Gary S Williams in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 9:15 AM. Judge Kussel appears telephonically from Shawano County. Court reviews file, this matter is currently set for a JT on 2/28/17. Williams states he still does not have an attorney, states that they have all stated that the attorneys will not take the case with this short of time. Court asks the defendant when he tried contacting the attorneys. Williams responds - just started calling after he was released from custody (1/21/17). Court - not happy about no counsel hired yet. Williams stated that he was told to get a SPD appointment and then let them go when he hires his own counsel. Williams stated that his step-son will borrow him the money for counsel. Court sets for STC on 2/27/17 at 1:00 PM and he should be here with counsel at that point or tell the Court who the attorney is. Court takes the JT off the calendar for this matter. State would prefer he be here with his counsel and also provide the court with a retainer letter.  Status conference scheduled for February 27, 2017 at 01:00 pm.
Status conference on February 7, 2017 at 09:30 am.
Jury trial on February 27, 2017 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Gary S Williams appears via video from FOSO, in court is his attorney William Allen Dickens.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 15CF70, 16CF52 and 16CF29. State believes Dickens is being terminated by defendant. Dickens believes that is true. Court questions Williams on why he would like to terminate attorney Dickens. Williams states his family is going to hire a paid attorney and feels a better plea deal could be offered. State will be asking for JT date. Court grants withdrawl of counsel (Dickens) and bond will continue on all three cases.  Status conference scheduled for February 7, 2017 at 09:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for February 27, 2017 at 08:30 am.
From Attorney Dickens to Judge Kussel regarding State's Motion in Limine and objects to motions as stated in letter.
Defendant's Motion ot Appear at Trial in Street Clothes and without Restraint
Jury trial on December 13, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial on September 15, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Gary S Williams in court with attorney William Allen Dickens.  Defendant Gary S Williams in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 1:48 PM. Called 15CF70, 16CF29 and 16CF52. Dickens informs Court that he is appearing specially today. State - scheduled for PH on 16CF52, AIA on 16CF29 and FPT on 15CF70. State has submitted to the Court exhibits #1 - copy of bond on 15CF70, #2 - copy of bond on 16CF29 and #3 - copy of bond on 16CF13. Court receives after no objections. Dickens - going forth with PH on 16CF52. State calls Lt. Jeff Marvin. Marvin sworn in at 1:50 PM. Direct exam by State. Record reflects proper identification of the defendant (1:52 PM). Marvin excused at 1:56 PM. Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed, binds over for trial. State files Information that mirrors the complaint. Dickens has Information, waives reading of it, will proceed to ARGN and enters NG pleas. Court accepts plea, continues bond, sets 16CF52 for FPT on 9/15/16 at 10:45 AM. Court address 16CF29. Dickens has complaint, waives reading of it, will be waiving PH on that matter. Court goes thru verbal waiver of PH collaquey. Dickens and Williams understand and are willing to waive PH. Court finds probable cause, binds over for trial, set for ARGN. Dickens willing to proceed to ARGN as State will file Information that will mirror the complaint, will proceed to ARGN and enters NG pleas to all counts. Court accepts pleas, sets this matter for FPT on 9/15/16 at 10:45 AM. State - bond on 16CF29 - asks for $600.00 cash (original $500.00 has been ordered forfeited). Dickens makes argument for lower bond or signature bond due to health conditions of the defendant. Court - bond - sets bond at an addtional $500.00 cash bond at this point with same conditions. State - 15CF70 - would prefer to set the matter for trial if it is not resolved. Court will set 15CF70 for JT on 9/15/16 at 8:30 AM.  Jury trial scheduled for September 15, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Final pre-trial on June 21, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
Final pre-trial on June 9, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
Final pre-trial on June 9, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Gary S Williams in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 2:04 PM. State was informed by Clerk that SPD still does not have an attorney for the defendant, cannot proceed with ARGN for those reasons. Williams agrees. Court will continue bond, sets this matter for another ARGN on 11/3/15 at 11:00 AM.  Arraignment scheduled for November 3, 2015 at 11:00 am.
granting motion to withdraw as counsel

Defendant Gary S Williams in court with attorney Mary L.R. Burns.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 10:20 AM. Burns has filed a motion to withdraw as counsel for stated reasons (conflict). Court grants motion to withdraw. Burns - SPD will appoint a different attorney. Court continues bond, sets for another ARGN. State has filed Information that mirrors the complaint and Burns has a copy of that.  Arraignment scheduled for September 22, 2015 at 09:45 am.

Defendant Gary S Williams in court with attorney Mary L.R. Burns.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 2:27 PM. State asks court to take judicial notice of two convictions from Shawano County. Burns has no objections. Court takes judicial notice of Shawano County convictions as stated by State. State calls Investigator Thomas Robinson. Robinson sworn in at 2:29 PM. Direct exam by State. Burns objects - leading - sustained (2:35 PM).  Record reflects defendant has been identified (2:49 PM). Witness excused (2:53PM). Court finds probable cause that a felonly was committed and binds over for trial. Burns would like an ARGN date. July 8, 2015 at 9:45 p.m.
